title: AI-Driven Assessment, Diagnostics for Joint and Muscle Health
description: Delivers insight into joint function, muscle health, and recovery needs using EMG and ROM – ideal for post-operative care, chronic pain management, and neurological and orthopedic diagnostics.
about_use_case:
The musculoskeletal and neuro-rehabilitation sectors face major challenges such as inconsistent assessment methods, subjective clinical judgments, lack of measurable recovery tracking methods, delayed diagnosis of underlying dysfunctions, and absence of standardized reporting.

Pheezee—an AI-powered, USFDA-listed, ISO 13485-certified medical device—addresses these challenges by enabling objective, data-driven diagnostics and personalized rehabilitation pathways. It bridges the gap between traditional clinical expertise and advanced technology by identifying joint and muscle dysfunction early, even before symptoms appear, objectively tracking muscle performance and joint mobility, supporting orthopedic and neurological condition management, enhancing post-operative recovery, and reducing long-term complications.

A smart AI-based screening process ensures that only patients requiring further analysis are guided to the Pheezee Assessment—an in-depth evaluation combining EMG (Electromyography) and ROM (Range of Motion) metrics to uncover the root cause of functional limitations.

Begin Screening Link: https://forms.fillout.com/t/uGsJXdbummus

Potential Use Cases:
1. Early Detection of Musculoskeletal Issues: Identify subtle signs of muscle weakness or joint restriction before pain or injury manifests. Ideal for general health checkups, wellness camps, and preventive health initiatives.
2. Objective Physiotherapy Assessments: Empower physiotherapists with quantifiable EMG and ROM data to replace subjective assessments and ensure consistent diagnosis across professionals and locations.
3. Progress Tracking and Report Automation: Visualize patient progress over time through automated tracking tools and instantly generate standardized AI-based reports that aid communication and documentation.
4. Post-Surgery Recovery Monitoring: Continuously monitor recovery after orthopedic or neurological surgeries using objective data to detect deviations early and avoid complications.
5. Personalized Rehab and Exercise Plans: Use patient-specific data to generate customized rehabilitation protocols that evolve dynamically as the patient improves, ensuring optimal care.
6. Elderly Mobility and Fall Risk Evaluation: Evaluate coordination, joint function, and mobility in older adults to detect fall risks early and implement mobility improvement strategies in elderly care programs.

Data Artifacts and Potential AI Solutions:
Input Data includes patient demography such as age, gender, height, weight, activity level, medical and surgical history, symptoms, and relevant investigations like MRI. Joint and muscle health data is collected using wearable sensors capturing EMG (muscle activity) and ROM (joint movement).

Potential Outputs include screening test results that flag individuals with potential issues and recommend full Pheezee assessments, along with downloadable reports containing AI-based risk classification, functional insights derived from EMG and ROM analysis, personalized rehabilitation recommendations, progress tracking across sessions, and clear communication of muscle strength, balance, and mobility.

Potential AI Solutions:
1. Precision in Decision-Making: Analyze real-time EMG and ROM data to eliminate subjectivity and support evidence-based treatment decisions.
2. Recovery Prediction: Use historical data and AI models to forecast patient recovery timelines, enabling better planning and resource allocation.
3. Enhanced Clinical Decision Support: Generate actionable insights from complex datasets and support clinicians with AI-recommended diagnostics, follow-up protocols, and treatment strategies.
4. Repetitive Stress and Occupational Health: Assess workers in physically demanding roles to prevent repetitive strain injuries and improve workplace health outcomes.
5. Population-Level Pattern Recognition: Aggregate anonymized data to identify public health trends across age groups, regions, or occupations for healthcare planning and policy formulation.

Potential Benefits:
- Enables better clinical decision-making through objective diagnostics.
- Improves patient trust and satisfaction via clear, visual progress reports.
- Supports return-to-work and fit-for-sport certifications by validating recovery readiness.
- Facilitates integration into preventive healthcare, wellness initiatives, and government-led public health programs.

Key Differentiators:
The Pheezee test is a non-invasive diagnostic tool for joint and muscle pain that captures critical physiological information not available through conventional imaging tools such as X-Ray, MRI, or CT scans. It helps patients understand the severity and root cause of joint pain, pinpoints affected muscles, and supports preventive healthcare by monitoring muscle and joint mobility over time to detect degradation early and enable timely corrective interventions.
